task.title: Importing keystore entries
task.shortdesc: The Signing and Keys view makes it easy to copy keys from one keystore to another.

step.cmd: If necessary, open the Signing and Keys view by selecting Window Show View Other and then selecting MOTODEV Studio Signing and Keys from the list of views. Note that this view is part of the MOTODEV Studio for Android perspective and is thus normally opened when you switch to that perspective.
From the list of keystores displayed in the Signing and Keys view, select the one into which the keys are to be copied.
In the Signing and Keys toolbar, click (Import Entries).
step.stepresult: The Import Entries dialog is displayed.

step.cmd: In the Source Keystore section of the dialog, select the keystore containing the keys to be imported, and supply the keystore's password (if necessary; the password is filled in automatically if you previously instructed MOTODEV Studio to save this keystore's password).
The keystore's entries should now be listed (if not, click Load). Select the entries to be copied. You must select at least one key or you will see the message "There are no entries to import".

For any selected keys that show "Not verified" in the Verified column, supply their passwords in the Password column. "Not verified" indicates that the password is either missing or incorrect. Note that if you previously instructed MOTODEV Studio to save the password for a given key, that key's password is automatically filled in for you.

taskbody.result: The selected keys are copied into the target keystore.
